    • Method Detail

      • getCommentPrefix

        public String getCommentPrefix()
        Description copied from class: Tokenizer
        Returns a prefix that can be prepended to the start of a line to comment it out. Returns null if the language does not have comments. For example, a C-like language could return "//". If the language also requires a suffix to end the comment, it should override Tokenizer.getCommentSuffix() to return this.
        Overrides:
        getCommentPrefix in class Tokenizer
        Returns:
        a comment prefix string, or null

      • getKeywords

        public static KeywordMap getKeywords()

      • getNaturalLanguageTokenTypes

        public EnumSet<TokenType> getNaturalLanguageTokenTypes()
        Description copied from class: Tokenizer
        Returns a set of token types that may contain natural language content. For example, in a typical programming language, natural language may appear only in comments and string literals. In contrast, a plain text editor might return a set consisting of the PLAIN token type, or even EnumSet.allOf( TokenType.class ).
        Overrides:
        getNaturalLanguageTokenTypes in class Tokenizer
        Returns:
        a set of token types that may contain

      • isBraceIndented

        public boolean isBraceIndented()
        Description copied from class: Tokenizer
        Returns true if the format being edited uses indented blocks marked by braces.
        Overrides:
        isBraceIndented in class Tokenizer
        Returns:
        true if the language uses C-style braces

      • tokenizeImpl

        protected TokenType tokenizeImpl(TokenType token,
                                 Segment line,
                                 int lineIndex)
        Description copied from class: Tokenizer
        Splits a single line of text into tokens. Concrete subclasses must implement this to perform tokenization for the target language. This method should call Tokenizer.addToken(int, ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.TokenType) for each token in the line, in order from the lowest character offset to the highest character offset.

        This method must return a token type to be used as the initial type for the following line. (The initial token type for line zero is always PLAIN.) For example, if one source line contains a multiline comment that is not terminated on that line, the tokenizer would return a comment token type as the initial token for the next line. When the next line is tokenized, it would receive this initial token type and so continue tokenizing the comment instead of treating the next line as uncommented code.

        Note that if the tokenizer does not depend on the initial token type, then you can override Tokenizer.isMultilineTokenizationRequired() to return false in order to boost tokenization performance.

        Specified by:
        tokenizeImpl in class Tokenizer
        Parameters:
        token - the initial token type for the line
        line - the line to be tokenized
        lineIndex - the zero-based index of the line in the document
        Returns:
        the initial token type for the next line
